instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message:
the board no water damage, it came with short on PP3V42_G3H near SMC i was fix the short and reball the SMC.
now green and orange light but no fan and nothing on SMC bypass.
3V42 - 3.4v
PPBUS - 8.6v
PPVRTC - 3.2v
5V_S5 - 5.0v
3V3_S5 -3.3v
3V3_SUS - 0.8v-1.3v playing up and down
PP1V05_SUS - 0.2v - 0.4v

PP5V_S4RS3 0.8v-1.3v playing up and down.

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message:
Do you mean pulsing every 5s?

Check for short all big coils; see if pulse too.

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message:
"Do you mean pulsing every 5s?"
No up and down all the time from 0.5v to 2.1v PP1V05_SUS a littel bit lower...cant find short on big coils

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message:
Monitor PM_SLP_SUS_L signal.
Post ALL RTC voltage, not only power.

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message:
"Monitor PM_SLP_SUS_L signal" i dont have scope. voltage on  PM_SLP_SUS_L 0v-1.9v runing.

RTC_RESET_L 3.3V stable.
PPVRTC_G3H 3.3V stable.
PPVOUT_S0_PCH_DCPRTC 1.3V
PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 0.4(U1900 LEG 12)

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message:
"ALL RTC"
Still missing some; look at PCH's RTC block connections...
Post PCH_SRTCRST_L, PCH_INTRUDER_L and PCH_INTVRMEN.

"i dont have scope"
Not really needed; voltmeter is good enough.

Also post PM_DSW_PWRGD and PCH_DSWVRMEN.

Mention any signal which not stable, fluctuating...

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message:
PCH_SRTCRST_L 3.2v
PCH_INTRUDER_L 2.9v
PCH_INTVRMEN 3.1v
PM_DSW_PWRGD 3.3v
PCH_DSWVRMEN 3.1v
all stable
PM_SLP_SUS_L 0.6v to 2v runing up and down. pulses

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message:
If 5V_S4 fluctuates, then PM_SLP_S5_L should fluctuate too.
Also check what happen with PM_SLP_S4/3_L.

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message: PM_SLP_S5/4/3_L - runing slow from 0.2v to 0.6v loop not...all 3 exectly the same.

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message:
An o-scope is better; it can catch peak value of any pulse.
Check if S3/0 voltages fluctuates too.

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message: There is few S3/0 missing voltage  and few fluctuates

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message:
Check if missing ones have fluctuation on corresponding enable signal.
Also check for short on them.

I don't remember if you tried SMC bypass mode...

threads.title: 820-00165, green/orange light OK, no FAN spin
threads.message:
PP3V3_S3 AND PP3V3_S3_EN  - 0V-0.2V LOOPS
TBTAPWRSW_ISET_S3_R 0V STABLE
PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L - 0V-0.3V LOOPS
P5VS4RS3_EN_RC - 0V-0.4V LOOPS
P5VS4RS3_EN_D 0V STABLE
SMC_1V2S3_ISENSE - 0V STABLE
PP3V3_S3_FET_R 0V-0.2V LOOPS
P5V_S4RS3_VFB1 - 0.9V-1.4V LOOPS
P5V_S4RS3_FUNC - 0V STABLE
PP1V2_S3 0.1V-0.2V
PPVTT_S3_DDR_BUF - 0V STABLE
PP1V8_S3_REG_R - 0.2V-0.6V LOOPS
P1V8S3_EN 0.1V-0.5V LOOPS
PP1V2_S3 0.2V-0.5V LOOPS

S0:
PP5V_S0 - 0.2V-0.9V
PP3V3_S0 - 0.2V-0.9V
TBTAPWRSW_ISET_S0 - 0V STABLE
SMC_P1V05S0_VSENSE 0V STABLE
ISNS_P3V3S0_VSENSE 0V STABLE


reset SMC do nothing
